Profile: foundation

The foundation profile is the smallest usable setup: “provider + orchestrator only”, with few or no tools and minimal extras.

Use it when

  • You want the simplest possible prompt → response flow
  • You’re debugging configuration issues (reduce variables)
  • You want minimal tool access for safety or policy reasons

Expected characteristics

  • Few tools: the model can’t take many actions, so it will mostly explain and suggest
  • Low complexity: fewer moving parts means fewer surprises
  • Lower risk: fewer ways to touch your system
Tradeoff
Minimal tools means the assistant cannot inspect your repo, run tests, or perform edits via tools. It’s great for “thinking” and planning, not for doing.

How it fits the architecture

foundation emphasizes the kernel+provider boundary: the orchestrator runs the loop, the provider makes model calls, and everything else is either disabled or kept to a minimum.
